data.title: Rudyard Kipling was born in Mumbai. His earliest years were blissfully happy. But at the tender age of five, he was sent back to England to stay with a foster family, where he was desperately unhappy.

6. Ahmed needs to see an optician because his driving is getting worse.

Please, can someone help me? Fill in the blanks with the correct words. A series of chemical reactions result in the release of energy by oxidation of food. When the diaphragm contracts, oxygen-rich air is taken into the lungs. The windpipe is made up of several ring-like structures, held together by cartilage. Carbon dioxide is available in small spaces between soil particles and plant roots typically take in oxygen. Aerobic respiration is the most efficient form of respiration.

Jules Verne, a Frenchman and a lawyer, devoted himself to writing enduring fantasies. Even more than a century after the author's birth, his grandson came to America in order to christen the Nautilus (the name his grandfather had given to his imaginary submarine). Sir Hubert Wilkins, an explorer, used it to reach the North Pole. Verne was a dreamer and writer. Among his first efforts was a children's story entitled "A Trip in a Balloon." He also wrote stories about a voyage to the center of the earth, about a rocket trip to the moon, and about a number of incredible voyages by submarine and airplane. Isn't this remarkable, since he was born in 1828 and died in 1905, long before we had rocket ships and submarines? Many of the achievements of our scientific and mechanical age are the realization of his marvelous visions. The space explorations, although not a direct result of Verne's vision, closely exemplify his cognizance of the "possibility of the impossible.

Directions: Read the sentences and choose the meaning of the underlined words.

1. The greedy child was snatching candy from the shelf.

A. Happy

B. Pleasant

C. Caring

D. Selfish

2. The sun suddenly vanished from view as the storm clouds rolled across the sky.

A. Appeared

B. Disappeared

C. Danced

D. Floated

3. The delightful aroma of food cooking in the kitchen made my mouth water.

A. Smell

B. Wealth

C. Color

D. Touch

4. You should not belittle his effort but thank him for trying.

A. Important

B. Unimportant

C. Inviting

D. Appealing

5. The man should go to jail for his inhumane treatment of his horses.

A. Loving

B. Proper

C. Giving

D. Cruel

(a) Fill in each of the numbered blanks with the correct form of the word given in brackets. Do not copy the passage but write in correct serial order the word or phrase appropriate for the blank space. Rudyard Kipling was born in Mumbai on December 30th, 1865, son of John Lockwood Kipling and his wife Alice. Rudyard's earliest years in Mumbai were happy, but at the tender age of five he was sent back to England with a foster family in Southsea, where he was desperately unhappy. The experience colored some of his later writings. Kipling was one of the most popular writers in England, in both prose and verse, in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Henry James said: "Kipling struck me personally as the most complete man of genius I have ever known." In 1907, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, making him the first English language writer to receive the prize, and to date, he remains the youngest.

Solve it if you spam, so I report your 10 answers. And if you solve it, I give you 10 thanks.

The king of Spain wished to celebrate the great event and do honor to the man who had made himself a national hero. He did so by holding a banquet in honor of the explorer. To this banquet, he invited many of the nobles of the king's court. Some of them were jealous of the success Columbus had achieved. One of them sat next to Columbus. He turned towards Columbus and said, "Of course, you are a brave man but anyone can take a ship and sail on land until he reaches land.

In an effort to recognize the sacrifice made by soldiers while defending the country, the Government on Wednesday approved the long-pending war memorial project in the National Capital. The Union Cabinet gave the go-ahead for the â‚¹500-crore project to build a National War Memorial and a National War Museum near India Gate in memory of over 22,500 soldiers who laid down their lives. The total time for completion of the entire project at Princess Park is estimated to be five years. The prestigious project will be monitored by a Committee chaired by the Defence Secretary and assisted by a project management team to ensure that the memorial is constructed within the stipulated time-frame.

Fill in each of the numbered blanks with the correct form of the word given in brackets. Do not copy the passage, but write in the correct serial order or phrase appropriate to the blank space. 4 marks

Example: 0) notices

Gratiano __0__ (notices) that Antonio does not __1__ (look) well and those who __2__ (care) too much about the world __3__ (lose) their happiness. Antonio __4__ (says) that this world is a stage where every man must play a part and his is a sad one. Gratiano __5__ (offers) to play the part of a jester who will encourage laughter, __6__ (causing) faces to wrinkle. He would rather __7__ (seek) pleasure in wine and harm his liver than burden his heart with sad groans which __8__ (would kill) him.
